content.raw: yep the refraction texture should replace the need for a semi-transparent ocean plane. If users choose to set `refractOpacity` to 0, they will get fully opaque ocean. So I think that should be ok. I've removed `scene_blend alpha_blend` from the material script. [34591dd](#!/osrf/vrx/commits/34591dd56f433c06d00191688a56b9f24993cf79)
content.html: yep the refraction texture should replace the need for a semi-transparent ocean plane. If users choose to set refractOpacity to 0, they will get fully opaque ocean. So I think that should be ok. I've removed scene_blend alpha_blend from the material script. 34591dd

update.description: The purpose of this PR is to take the knowledge and experimentation learned from [#!/osrf/vrx/pull-requests/161](#!/osrf/vrx/pull-requests/161) to integrate ocean reflections to the existing wave shaders.
update.title: Issue#122 Ocean Reflections

content.raw: You can test a cylinder, make it tall and skinny and see how it refracts
content.html: You can test a cylinder, make it tall and skinny and see how it refracts

content.raw: I actually believe that the water should not be transparent, except by refraction. In real life, we don’t see the actual object under water, but we see the “refraction texture” of the object, not a mixture of both. For example, Fresnel effect → If view water from parallel angle, should so max reflection and min refraction \(less stuff underwater\). However, if we have the ocean transparent, then it would still be fully visible still, just not refraction effects on top. Let me know if there is something im missing.
content.html: I actually believe that the water should not be transparent, except by refraction. In real life, we don’t see the actual object under water, but we see the “refraction texture” of the object, not a mixture of both. For example, Fresnel effect → If view water from parallel angle, should so max reflection and min refraction (less stuff underwater). However, if we have the ocean transparent, then it would still be fully visible still, just not refraction effects on top. Let me know if there is something im missing.

content.raw: Compare by going to materials/scripts/waves.material and commenting out `scene_blend alpha_blend`
content.html: Compare by going to materials/scripts/waves.material and commenting out scene_blend alpha_blend

content.raw: @{557058:4ded1ddf-947e-4154-bbd1-3dba24f1bdbd} from the images you shared here [https://ci.mil.ufl.edu/labelme/datasets/navigator-datasets/](https://ci.mil.ufl.edu/labelme/datasets/navigator-datasets), it seems that the water is not very transparent, which is why I originally removed the ocean transparency. Let me know how the refraction should look. Honestly not sure how it should look, except distorted and slightly offset \(straight lines have breaks\)
content.html: @Carlos Agüero from the images you shared here https://ci.mil.ufl.edu/labelme/datasets/navigator-datasets/, it seems that the water is not very transparent, which is why I originally removed the ocean transparency. Let me know how the refraction should look. Honestly not sure how it should look, except distorted and slightly offset (straight lines have breaks)

content.raw: Still needs changes to #if statements. Can you help me test it out with gz7 and verify the #if works as desired?
content.html: Still needs changes to #if statements. Can you help me test it out with gz7 and verify the #if works as desired?

In 1723:6a0a23156279, I have made the following changes since:

  • Added back transparency in ocean, so the propellers should always be seen
  • Updated the sdf parameter names to reflectOpacity and refractOpacity for clarity
  • Added sdf parameter rttNoise the scales the amount of distortion
  • I made both reflection and refraction distorted
  /// 2. <enableRtt> (bool, default: true)
  ///    Display reflection and reflections if set to true.
  ///
  /// 3. <rttNoise> (double, default: 0.1)
  ///    Amount of distortion in reflection/refraction.
  ///
  /// 4. <refractOpacity> (double, default: 0.2)
  ///    Ratio between shallow water color and refraction color to use
  ///    In [0, 1], where 0 is no refraction and 1 is maximum refraction
  ///
  /// 5. <reflectOpacity> (double, default: 0.2)
  ///    Ratio between environment color and reflection color to use
  ///    In [0, 1], where 0 is no reflection and 1 is maximum reflection
  ///

Play around with these numbers and let me know how you find it. The reflection distortion actually looks quite nice, as the reflections are very distorted far away, but obvious and good up close. I did find the transparent water to be a bit strange, as shown in the image in the previous comment. The mixture of original thruster and refracted thruster looks a bit strange in my opinion. Otherwise, this should be good!

content.raw:
I made the water non-transparent by removing the line `scene_blend alpha_blend`.  I will turn it back on. I removed it because I found it to look a bit strange with both the distorted refraction and transparent image together, as shown below

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/1008870784-image.png)
content.html: I made the water non-transparent by removing the line scene_blend alpha_blend. I will turn it back on. I removed it because I found it to look a bit strange with both the distorted refraction and transparent image together, as shown below

content.raw: Great will do.
content.html: Great will do.

content.raw: looking at the code, the `shallowRefractionRatio` and `envReflectionRatio`  params determines the ratio of which these reflection/ refraction textures are mixed into the final output color.  The higher the values, the more visible they are. So maybe we can rename them to something like `shallowRefractionOpacity` and `envReflectionOpacity` to avoid the confusion?
content.html: looking at the code, the shallowRefractionRatio and envReflectionRatio params determines the ratio of which these reflection/ refraction textures are mixed into the final output color. The higher the values, the more visible they are. So maybe we can rename them to something like shallowRefractionOpacity and envReflectionOpacity to avoid the confusion?

content.raw: I did a few tests and if I set refraction to `0`, the water doesn’t look transparent anymore and I don’t see the propeller under the water. If I increment the refraction value, I start seeing the propeller. Not sure if I notice any effect in the reflected image while changing the refraction. Is this expected? My naive intuition about refraction was expecting a reflected distortion proportional to the refraction value.
content.html: I did a few tests and if I set refraction to 0, the water doesn’t look transparent anymore and I don’t see the propeller under the water. If I increment the refraction value, I start seeing the propeller. Not sure if I notice any effect in the reflected image while changing the refraction. Is this expected? My naive intuition about refraction was expecting a reflected distortion proportional to the refraction value.

content.raw: I made it so that the "noise" only affects objects under water, not the above water reflection, as it looked very strange when above water. Let me know if you think that this should be added to the reflection as well, but it just looked strange. That is from the `.frag` file now having reflectFinal and refractFinal.
content.html: I made it so that the "noise" only affects objects under water, not the above water reflection, as it looked very strange when above water. Let me know if you think that this should be added to the reflection as well, but it just looked strange. That is from the .frag file now having reflectFinal and refractFinal.

content.raw:
Thank you. I have made the change to show a refraction effect. Changes made: 

1. Removed `scene_blend alpha_blend`, which tried to make the ocean transparent, which conflicted with refractions. This way, if `shallowRefractRatio == 0.0`, no objects below water can be seen.
2.  We can now tune the `noiseScale` parameter in `wave_gazebo/world_models/ocean_waves/materials/scripts/waves.material` to increase or decrease the amount of refraction movement we see.
3. Used the above example as inspiration, but rather than making a new `noiseCoord` variable, I reused the `bumpCoord` variable already used to keep the shader less confusing. Let me know if this works!
content.html:
Thank you. I have made the change to show a refraction effect. Changes made:

  1. Removed scene_blend alpha_blend, which tried to make the ocean transparent, which conflicted with refractions. This way, if shallowRefractRatio == 0.0, no objects below water can be seen.
  2. We can now tune the noiseScale parameter in wave_gazebo/world_models/ocean_waves/materials/scripts/waves.material to increase or decrease the amount of refraction movement we see.
  3. Used the above example as inspiration, but rather than making a new noiseCoord variable, I reused the bumpCoord variable already used to keep the shader less confusing. Let me know if this works!

content.raw: Great! @{557058:4ded1ddf-947e-4154-bbd1-3dba24f1bdbd} would you be able to make the change to the #if statements and test it on gz7? I don’t have it setup on my system, so it would probably be much more effective to do it from your end.
content.html: Great! @Carlos Agüero would you be able to make the change to the #if statements and test it on gz7? I don’t have it setup on my system, so it would probably be much more effective to do it from your end.

content.raw: the `noiseNormal` and `fresnel` components from ogre sample’s fresnel [shaders program](https://bitbucket.org/sinbad/ogre/src/v1-9-0/Samples/Media/materials/programs/GLSL150/Example_FresnelFp.glsl) should help give some subtle refraction effect
content.html: the noiseNormal and fresnel components from ogre sample’s fresnel shaders program should help give some subtle refraction effect

content.raw:
It's not very evident to me the effect of refraction. Here are two images that I took, the upper one is with refraction set to `0` and the lower one has refraction set to `1`. In both cases, reflection is set to `1` to make the changes more evident.

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/469557973-refraction_0.png)
![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/585719843-refraction_1.png)
content.html: It's not very evident to me the effect of refraction. Here are two images that I took, the upper one is with refraction set to 0 and the lower one has refraction set to 1. In both cases, reflection is set to 1 to make the changes more evident.

content.raw: created a [PR](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/3119) to backport the render events to gazebo7
content.html: created a PR to backport the render events to gazebo7

content.raw: Oh, I see that these comments are in `WavefieldVisualPlugin.hh` now.
content.html: Oh, I see that these comments are in WavefieldVisualPlugin.hh now.

content.raw: I don't see this section in `model.xacro`. I see the parameters but not the comments. I wonder if you forgot to commit something.
content.html: I don't see this section in model.xacro. I see the parameters but not the comments. I wonder if you forgot to commit something.

This PR should be good to go! Please test it out and let me know if anything else needs to be added Thanks to Ian for all of the help.

In wave_gazebo/world_models/ocean_waves/model.xacro, we now have 

  /// 1. <enableRtt> (bool, default: true)
  ///    Display reflection and reflections if set to true.
  ///
  /// 2. <shallowRefractRatio> (double, default: 0.2)
  ///    Ratio between shallow water color and refraction color to use
  ///    In [0, 1], where 0 is no refraction and 1 is maximum refraction
  ///
  /// 3. <envReflectRatio> (double, default: 0.2)
  ///    Ratio between environment color and reflection color to use
  ///    In [0, 1], where 0 is no reflection and 1 is maximum reflection

Play with this if needed. Make sure that you have the most up to date version of Gazebo or it will not have the reflections. 

    $ sudo apt update
    $ sudo apt full-upgrade

Then you can run with source ~/vrx_ws/devel/setup.bash && cd ~/vrx_ws && catkin_make && source ~/vrx_ws/devel/setup.bash && roslaunch vrx_gazebo vrx.launch verbose:=true. Confirm that the reflections look good in the client and by running rosrun image_view image_view image:=/wamv/sensors/cameras/middle_right_camera/image_raw and rosrun image_view image_view image:=/wamv/sensors/cameras/front_right_camera/image_raw

content.raw: This issue has been resolved by checking that the Gazebo version is >=9.11. Versions earlier than this will have no reflection/refraction.
content.html: This issue has been resolved by checking that the Gazebo version is >=9.11. Versions earlier than this will have no reflection/refraction.

content.raw: Unfortunately, it’s still not passing the pipeline, likely because it is not using the most up to date version of gazebo. It passes for kinetic, but not melodic.
content.html: Unfortunately, it’s still not passing the pipeline, likely because it is not using the most up to date version of gazebo. It passes for kinetic, but not melodic.

content.raw:
Ian has added the `ConnectCameraPreRender` method to the most recent gazebo release. To get this, I ran: 

```
    $ sudo apt update
    $ sudo apt full-upgrade
```

Then, I added an `enableRtt` variable and sdf parameter, which defaults to true. It is false for gz7, so we can avoid this build issue. Essentially, reflection/refraction will always be turned off for gz7.

```
/tmp/vrx_ws/src/build/wave_gazebo_plugins/src/WavefieldVisualPlugin.cc:301:7: error: 'ConnectCameraPreRender' is not a member of 'gazebo::rendering::Events'
      rendering::Events::ConnectCameraPreRender(
      ^
build/wave_gazebo_plugins/CMakeFiles/WavefieldVisualPlugin.dir/build.make:62: recipe for target 'build/wave_gazebo_plugins/CMakeFiles/WavefieldVisualPlugin.dir/src/WavefieldVisualPlugin.cc.o' failed
make[2]: *** [build/wave_gazebo_plugins/CMakeFiles/WavefieldVisualPlugin.dir/src/WavefieldVisualPlugin.cc.o] Error 1
make[1]: *** [build/wave_gazebo_plugins/CMakeFiles/WavefieldVisualPlugin.dir/all] Error 2
CMakeFiles/Makefile2:1149: recipe for target 'build/wave_gazebo_plugins/CMakeFiles/WavefieldVisualPlugin.dir/all' failed
Makefile:138: recipe for target 'all' failed
```
content.html:
Ian has added the ConnectCameraPreRender method to the most recent gazebo release. To get this, I ran: 

    $ sudo apt update
    $ sudo apt full-upgrade

Then, I added an enableRtt variable and sdf parameter, which defaults to true. It is false for gz7, so we can avoid this build issue. Essentially, reflection/refraction will always be turned off for gz7.

/tmp/vrx_ws/src/build/wave_gazebo_plugins/src/WavefieldVisualPlugin.cc:301:7: error: 'ConnectCameraPreRender' is not a member of 'gazebo::rendering::Events'
      rendering::Events::ConnectCameraPreRender(
      ^
build/wave_gazebo_plugins/CMakeFiles/WavefieldVisualPlugin.dir/build.make:62: recipe for target 'build/wave_gazebo_plugins/CMakeFiles/WavefieldVisualPlugin.dir/src/WavefieldVisualPlugin.cc.o' failed
make[2]: *** [build/wave_gazebo_plugins/CMakeFiles/WavefieldVisualPlugin.dir/src/WavefieldVisualPlugin.cc.o] Error 1
make[1]: *** [build/wave_gazebo_plugins/CMakeFiles/WavefieldVisualPlugin.dir/all] Error 2
CMakeFiles/Makefile2:1149: recipe for target 'build/wave_gazebo_plugins/CMakeFiles/WavefieldVisualPlugin.dir/all' failed
Makefile:138: recipe for target 'all' failed
